sentences.text: NOTICE OF ANNUAL MEETING AND PROXY STATEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: March 7, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dear Fellow Stockholders:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are pleased to invite you to the 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders (Annual Meeting) of Fortune Brands Home & Security, Inc. on Tuesday, May 2, 2017 at 8:00 a.m. (CDT) at the Renaissance Chicago North Shore Hotel, 933 Skokie Boulevard, Northbrook, Illinois.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following matters will be considered at the Annual Meeting:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 1:    The election of the three director nominees identified in this Proxy Statement for a three year term expiring at the 2020 Annual Meeting of Stockholders (see pages 5 to 8);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 2:    The ratification of the appointment by the Companys Audit Committee of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm for 2017 (see page 44);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 3:    An advisory vote on the compensation paid to the Companys named executive officers (see page 45); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: such other business as may properly come before the Annual Meeting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders of record at the close of business on March 3, 2017, the record date for the Annual Meeting, are entitled to vot Stockholders who wish to attend the Annual Meeting in person should review the instructions beginning on page 1.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: YOUR VOTE IS VERY IMPORTANT.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WHETHER OR NOT YOU PLAN TO ATTEND THE ANNUAL MEETING, PLEASE SUBMIT YOUR PROXY OR VOTING INSTRUCTIONS AS SOON AS POSSIBLE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See pages 1-4 for voting instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Proxy Statement and accompanying proxy are first being distributed on or about March 14, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Robert K. Biggart Senior Vice President, General Counsel and Secretary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Important Notice Regarding the Availability of Proxy Materials the 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders to be Held on Tuesday, May 2, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Notice of Annual Meeting and Proxy Statement and the Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2016 (Form 10-K) are available at www.proxyvote.com.

sentences.text: FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Why did I receive these materials?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These materials were provided to you in connection with the solicitation by the Board of Directors (the Board) of Fortune Brands Home & Security, Inc. (Fortune Brands or the Company), of proxies to be voted at our Annual Meeting and at any adjournment or postponement of the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Annual Meeting will take place on May 2, 2017 at 8:00 a.m. (CDT) at the Renaissance Chicago North Shore Hotel, 933 Skokie Boulevard, Northbrook, Illinois.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Proxy Statement describes the matters on which you, as a stockholder, are entitled to vote and gives you the information that you need to make an informed decision on these matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Why did I receive a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials instead of printed proxy materials?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Companies are permitted to provide stockholders with access to proxy materials over the Internet instead of mailing a printed copy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We mailed a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials (the Notice) to most stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Notice contains instructions on how to access the proxy materials on the Internet, how to vote and how to request a printed set of proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This approach reduces the environmental impact and our costs of printing and distributing the proxy materials, while providing a convenient method of accessing the materials and voting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company will make its Annual Report on Form 10-K for the last fiscal year, including any financial statements or schedules, available to stockholders without charge, upon written request to the Secretary, Fortune Brands Home & Security, Inc., 520 Lake Cook Road, Deerfield, Illinois 60015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company will furnish exhibits to Form 10-K to each stockholder requesting them upon payment of a $.10 per page fee to cover the Companys cost.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Can I get electronic access to the proxy materials if I received printed materials?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Yes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you received printed proxy materials, you can also access them online at www.proxyvote.com before voting your shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys proxy materials are also available on our website at http://ir.fbhs.com/annuals-proxies.cfm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders are encouraged to elect to receive future proxy materials electronically.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you opt to receive our future proxy materials electronically, you will receive an email next year with instructions containing a link to view those proxy materials and a link to the proxy voting website.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your election to receive proxy materials by email will remain in effect until you terminate it or for as long as the email address provided by you is valid.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders of record who wish to participate can enroll at http://enroll.icsdelivery.com/fbhs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are held in an account by a bank, broker or other nominees, you should check with your bank, broker or other nominee regarding the availability of this service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What is the difference between being a stockholder of record and a beneficial owner?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are registered directly in your name with Wells Fargo Shareowner Services, the Companys transfer agent, you are the stockholder of record.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are held in an account by a bank, broker or other nominee, you hold your shares in street name and are a beneficial owner of those shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The majority of stockholders are beneficial owners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For such shares, a bank, broker or other nominee is considered the stockholder of record for purposes of voting at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beneficial owners have the right to direct their bank, broker or other nominee on how to vote the shares held in their account by using the voting instructions provided by the bank, broker or other nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Who is entitled to vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Only stockholders who owned the Companys common stock of record at the close of business on March 3, 2017 (the Record Date) are entitled to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each holder of common stock is entitled to one vote per share.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There were 153,504,413 shares of common stock outstanding on the Record Date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS (CONTINUED)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Who can attend the Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Only stockholders who owned Fortune Brands common stock as of the close of business on the Record Date, or their authorized representatives, may attend the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the entrance to the meeting, stockholders will be asked to present valid photo identification to determine if you owned common stock on the Record Date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are acting as a proxy, you will need to submit a valid written legal proxy signed by the owner of the common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You must bring such evidence with you to be admitted to the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders who own their shares in street name will be required to submit proof of ownership at the entrance to the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Either your voting instruction card or brokerage statement reflecting your stock ownership as of the Record Date may be used as proof of ownership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What matters will be voted on at the Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Three matters will be considered at the Annual Meeting, which are:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the election of three Class III directors identified in this Proxy Statement (Proposal 1);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the ratification of the appointment of our independent registered public accounting firm (Proposal 2); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the advisory vote on the compensation paid to the Companys named executive officers (Proposal 3).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How do I vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you received a Notice in the mail, you can either vote by
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) Internet (www.proxyvote.com) or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) in person at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting instructions are provided on the Notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may also request to receive printed proxy materials in the mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders who received printed proxy materials in the mail can vote by
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) filling out the proxy card and returning it in the postage paid return envelope,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) Internet (www.proxyvote.com), or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) in person at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting instructions are provided on the proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders who received proxy materials electronically can vote by
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) Internet (www.proxyvote.com),
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) telephone (800-690-6903), or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) in person at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are not the stockholder of record, but are a beneficial owner of our shares, you must vote by giving instructions to your bank, broker or other nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You should follow the voting instructions on the form that you receive from your bank, broker or other nominee, which will include details on available voting methods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To be able to vote in person at the Annual Meeting, you must obtain a legal proxy from your bank, broker or other nominee in advance and present it to the Inspector of Election with your completed ballot at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How will my proxy be voted?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your proxy card, when properly signed and returned to us, or processed by telephone or via the Internet, and not revoked, will be voted in accordance with your instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any matter is properly presented other than the three proposals described above, the Proxy Committee (the persons named in the enclosed proxy card or, if applicable, their substitutes), will have discretion to vote your shares in their best judgment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What if I dont mark the boxes on my proxy or voting instruction card?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless you give other instructions on your proxy card or your voting instruction card, or unless you give other instructions when you cast your vote by telephone or the Internet, the Proxy Committee will vote your shares in accordance with the recommendations of the Board, which are FOR Proposals 1, 2 and 3.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS (CONTINUED)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you hold shares beneficially and you have not provided voting instructions, your bank, broker or other nominee is only permitted to use its discretion and vote your shares on certain routine matters (Proposal 2).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you have not provided voting instructions to your bank, broker or other nominee on non-routine matters (Proposals 1 and 3), your bank, broker or other nominee is not permitted to use discretion and vote your shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, we urge you to give voting instructions to your bank, broker or other nominee on all three proposals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares that are not permitted to be voted by your bank, broker or other nominee with respect to any matter are called broker non-votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broker non-votes are not considered votes for or against a proposal and will have no direct impact.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How many votes are needed to approve a proposal?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The nominees for director, in non-contested elections, must receive a majority of the votes cast at the Annual Meeting, in person or by proxy, to be elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A proxy card marked to abstain on the election of a director and any broker non-votes will not be counted as a vote cast with respect to that director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Companys majority vote Bylaw provision relating to the election of directors, if the number of votes cast for a director nominee does not exceed the number of votes cast against the director nominee, then the director must tender his or her resignation from the Board promptly after the certification of the stockholder vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board (excluding the nominee in question) will decide within 90 days of that certification, through a process managed by the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee, whether to accept the resignation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Boards explanation of its decision will be promptly disclosed in a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The affirmative vote of shares representing a majority in voting power of the common stock, present in person or represented by proxy at the Annual Meeting, and entitled to vote is necessary for the approval of Proposals 2 and 3.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxy cards marked to abstain on Proposals 2 and 3 will have the effect of a negative vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broker non-votes are not applicable to Proposal 2 because your bank, broker or other nominee will be permitted to use discretion to vote your shares on this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broker non-votes will have no impact on Proposals 1 and 3.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How can I revoke my proxy or change my vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may revoke your proxy by giving written notice to the Secretary of the Company or by delivering a later dated proxy at any time before it is actually voted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you voted on the Internet or by telephone, you may change your vote by voting again.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your last vote is the vote that will be counted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attendance at the Annual Meeting does not revoke your proxy unless you vote at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Will my vote be public?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a matter of policy, proxies, ballots and tabulations that identify individual stockholders are not publicly disclosed, but are available to the independent Inspector of Election, the proxy solicitation firm and certain employees of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What constitutes a quorum?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The presence at the Annual Meeting, in person or by proxy, of the holders of a majority in voting power of the issued and outstanding shares of common stock entitled to vote will constitute a quorum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxies received but marked as abstentions or without any voting instructions will be included in the calculation of the number of shares considered to be present at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board is soliciting this proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company will bear the expense of soliciting proxies for this Annual Meeting, ncluding mailing costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To assure that there is sufficient representation at the Annual Meeting, our proxy solicitor or our employees may solicit proxies by telephone, facsimile or in person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have retained Innisfree M&A Incorporated as our proxy solicitor for a fee estimated at $15,000, plus reasonable out-of-pocket expenses, to aid in soliciting proxies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our total expenses will depend upon the volume of shares represented by the proxies received in response to the Notice and Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS (CONTINUED)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What if I am a participant in the Fortune Brands Home & Security Retirement Savings Plan or the Fortune Brands Home & Security Hourly Employee Retirement Savings Plan?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are mailing a printed copy of the proxy materials to participants in the Fortune Brands Home & Security Retirement Savings Plan and the Fortune Brands Home & Security Hourly Employee Retirement Savings Plan (collectively, the Savings Plans) who invest in the Fortune Brands Stock Fund through the Savings Plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Trustee of the Savings Plans, as record holder of the Fortune Brands common stock held in the Savings Plans, will vote whole shares attributable to your interest in the Fortune Brands Stock Fund in accordance with your directions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you invest in the Fortune Brands Stock Fund under the Savings Plans and you sign and return the enclosed proxy card, we will forward it to the Trustee of the Savings Plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proxy card will serve as instruction to the Trustee to vote the whole shares attributable to your interest in the manner you indicate on the card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Trustee does not receive timely direction with respect to the voting of your shares held in the Fortune Brands Stock Fund, the Trustee will vote such shares in the same manner and in the same proportion as the shares for which the Trustee received voting instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How can I eliminate multiple mailings to the same address?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you and other residents at your mailing address are registered stockholders and you receive more than one copy of the Notice, but you wish to eliminate the duplicate mailings, you must submit a written request to the Companys transfer agent, Wells Fargo.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To request the elimination of duplicate copies, please write to Wells Fargo Shareowner Services, 1110 Centre Pointe Curve, Suite 101, MAC N9173-010, Mendota Heights, Minnesota 55120.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you and other residents at your mailing address own shares in street name, your broker, bank or other nominee may have sent you a notice that your household will receive only one Notice or one set of proxy materials for each company in which you hold stock through that broker, bank or other nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This practice, known as householding, is designed to reduce our printing and postage costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you did not respond, the bank, broker or other nominee will assume that you have consented, and will send only one copy of the Notice to your address.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may revoke your consent to householding at any time by sending your name, the name of your brokerage firm, and your account number to Broadridge, Householding Department, 51 Mercedes Way, Edgewood, New York 11717.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The revocation of your consent to householding will be effective 30 days following its receipt.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In any event, if you did not receive an individual copy of the Notice, or if you wish to receive individual copies of the Notice or our proxy materials for future meetings, we will send a copy to you if you call Shareholder Services at (847) 484-4538, or write to the Secretary of Fortune Brands Home & Security, Inc., 520 Lake Cook Road, Deerfield, Illinois 60015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How can I submit a stockholder proposal or nomination next year?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Bylaws provide that in order for a stockholder to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) nominate a candidate for election to our Board at the 2018 Annual Meeting of Stockholders, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) propose business for consideration at the 2018 Annual Meeting of Stockholders, written notice containing the information required by the Bylaws must be delivered to the Secretary of the Company no less than 90 days nor more than 120 days before the anniversary of the prior years Annual Meeting, that is, after January 2, 2018 but no later than February 1, 2018 for the 2018 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under SEC rules, if a stockholder wishes to submit a proposal for possible inclusion in the Companys 2018 proxy statement pursuant to Rule 14a-8 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (Exchange Act), we must receive it on or before November 14, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The person presiding at the Annual Meeting is authorized to determine if a proposed matter is properly brought before the Annual Meeting or if a nomination is properly made.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Copies of our Restated Certificate of Incorporation and Bylaws are available upon written request to the Secretary, Fortune Brands Home & Security, Inc., 520 Lake Cook Road, Deerfield, Illinois 60015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 1  ELECTION OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Summary of Qualification of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that all directors must possess a considerable amount of education and business management experience (such as experience as a chief executive, chief operating, chief financial officer or other relevant experience).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also believes that it is necessary for each of the Companys directors to possess many qualities and skills.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that there are certain general requirements which are mandatory for service on the Companys Board, while there are other skills and experiences that should be represented on the Board as a whole, but not necessarily by each individual director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: General requirements for all directors:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Extensive executive leadership experience
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: High level of integrity and ethics
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Original thinking  Strong commitme
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specific experiences, qualifications, and backgrounds to be represented on the Board as a whole:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Financial and/or accounting expertise
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Knowledge of international markets
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Chief executive officer/chief operating officer/chief financial officer experience
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Diversity of skill, background and viewpoint
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The process used by the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee in recommending qualified director candidates is escribed below under Corporate Governance  Director Nomination Process (see page 10 of this Proxy Statement).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Election of Class III Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board consists of eight members and is divided into three classes, each having three year terms that expire in successive years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The term of the Class III directors expires at the 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fortune Brands is committed to maintaining strong corporate governance practices that are good for our stockholders and our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are dedicated to maintaining these practices and upholding high standards of conduct.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance Principles
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board adopted a set of Corporate Governance Principles which describe our corporate governance practices and address corporate governance issues such as Board composition and responsibilities, Board meeting procedures, the establishment of Board committees, management succession planning process and review of risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance Principles are available at http://ir.fbhs.com/corporate-governance.cfm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Independence
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys Corporate Governance Principles provide that a majority of the members of the Board shall be independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: New York Stock Exchange requirements, as well as the Companys committee charters, require each member of the Audit, Compensation and Nominating and Corporate Governance Committees to be independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board applies the definition of independence found in the New York Stock Exchange Listed Company Manual in determining which directors are independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When determining each directors independence, the Board also considered charitable contributions made by the Company to organizations with which each director is affiliated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Applying that definition, Messrs. Mackay, Morikis, Thomas, Wesley and Waters and Mses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hackett and Kilsby were affirmatively determined by the Board to be independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Due to Mr. Kleins employment with the Company, he is not considered independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: None of the non-employee directors has any material relationship with the Company other than being a director and stockholder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Also, none of the non-employee directors have participated in any transaction or arrangement that interferes with such directors independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Policies with Respect to Transactions with Related Persons
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has adopted a Code of Business Conduct & Ethics which sets forth various policies and procedures intended to promote the ethical behavior of all of the Companys employees, officers and directors (the Code of Conduct).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Code of Conduct describes the Companys policy on conflicts of interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has established a Compliance Committee (comprised of management) which is responsible for administering and monitoring compliance with the Code of Conduct.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compliance Committee periodically reports on the Companys compliance efforts to the Audit Committee and to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has also established a Conflicts of Interest Committee (comprised of management) which is responsible for administering, interpreting and applying the Companys Conflicts of Interest Policy, which describes the types of relationships that may constitute a conflict of interest with the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Conflicts of Interest Policy, directors and executive officers are responsible for reporting any potential related person transaction (as defined in Item 404 of Regulation S-K) to the Conflicts of Interest Committee in advance of commencing a potential transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Conflicts of Interest Committee will present to the Audit Committee any potential related party transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee will evaluate the transaction, determine whether the interest of the related person is material and approve or ratify, as the case may be, the transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Companys executive officers and directors annually complete a questionnaire on which they are required to disclose any related person transactions and potential conflicts of interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The General Counsel reviews the responses to the questionnaires and, if a related person transaction is reported by a director or executive officer, submits the transaction for review by the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Conflicts of Interest Committee also reviews potential conflicts of interest and reports findings involving any director of the Company to the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee (the Nominating Committee).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee will review any potential conflict of interest involving a member of the Board to determine whether such potential conflict would affect that directors independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE (CONTINUED)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Certain Relationships and Related Transactions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since January 1, 2016, the Company did not participate in any transactions in which any of its directors, executive officers, any immediate family member of a director or executive officer or any beneficial owner of more than 5% of the Companys common stock had a direct or indirect material interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Nomination Process
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee is responsible for, among other things, screening potential director candidates, recommending qualified candidates to the Board for nomination and assessing director independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When identifying director candidates, the Nominating Committee determines whether there are any evolving needs that require an expert in a particular field or other specific skills or experiences.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When evaluating director candidates, the Nominating Committee first considers a candidates management experience and then considers issues of judgment, background, stature, conflicts of interest, integrity, ethics and commitment to the goal of maximizing stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee also focuses on issues of diversity, such as diversity of gender, race and national origin, education, professional experience and differences in viewpoints and skills.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee does not have a formal policy with respect to diversity; however, the Board and the Nominating Committee believe that it is essential that the Board members represent diverse viewpoints.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In considering candidates for the Board, the Nominating Committee considers the entirety of each candidates credentials in the context of these standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to the nomination of continuing directors for re-election, the individuals contributions to the Board are also considered.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the purpose of this Annual Meeting, the Nominating Committee recommended the nomination of Messrs. Mackay, Thomas and Wesley as Class III directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with future director elections, or at any time there is a vacancy on the Board, the Nominating Committee may retain a third-party search firm to assist in locating qualified candidates that meet the needs of the Board at that time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is the Nominating Committees policy to consider director candidates recommended by stockholders, if such recommendations are properly submitted to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders that wish to recommend an individual as a director candidate for consideration by the Nominating Committee can do so by writing to the Secretary of Fortune Brands Home & Security, Inc. at 520 Lake Cook Road, Deerfield, Illinois 60015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recommendations must include the proposed nominees name, biographical data and qualifications, as well as other information that would be required if the stockholder were actually nominating the recommended candidate pursuant to the procedures for such nominations provided in our Bylaws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee will consider the candidate and the candidates qualifications in the same manner in which it evaluates nominees identified by the Nominating Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee may contact the stockholder making the nomination to discuss the qualifications of the candidate and the stockholders reasons for making the nomination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Members of the Nominating Committee may then interview the candidate if the committee deems the candidate to be appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee may use the services of a third-party search firm to provide additional information about the candidate prior to making a recommendation to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committees nomination process is designed to ensure that the Nominating Committee fulfills its responsibility to recommend candidates that are properly qualified to serve the Company for the benefit of all of its stockholders, consistent with the standards established under the Companys Corporate Governance Principles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Communication with the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board and management encourage communication from the Companys stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders who wish to communicate with the Companys management should direct their communication to the Chief Executive Officer or the Secretary of Fortune Brands Home & Security, Inc. at 520 Lake Cook Road, Deerfield, Illinois 60015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders, or other interested parties, who wish to communicate with the non-management
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE (CONTINUED)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: directors or any individual director should direct their communication c/o the Secretary at the address above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Secretary will forward communications intended for the Board to the Chairman of the Board, or, if intended for an individual director, to that director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If multiple communications are received on a similar topic, the Secretary may, in his or her discretion, forward only representative correspondence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any communications that are abusive, in bad taste or present safety or security concerns may be handled differently.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Leadership Structure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Thomas serves as the Companys non-executive, independent Chairman.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board determined that having an independent director serve as Chairman of the Board is in the best interests of our stockholders at this time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This leadership structure aids the Boards oversight of management and allows our Chief Executive Officer to focus primarily on his management responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The non-executive Chairman has the responsibility of presiding at all meetings of the Board, consulting with the Chief Executive Officer on Board meeting agendas, acting as a liaison between management and the non-management directors, including maintaining frequent contact with the Chief Executive Officer and advising him or her on the efficiency of the Board meetings, facilitating teamwork and communication between the non-management directors and management, as well as additional responsibilities that are more fully described in the Companys Corporate Governance Principles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Companys non-executive Chairman facilitates the Boards annual performance assessment of the Chief Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board does not believe that a single leadership structure is right at all times, so the Board periodically reviews its leadership structure to determine, based on the circumstances at the time, whether other leadership structures might be appropriate for the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has been and remains committed to maintaining strong corporate governance and appropriate independent oversight of management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Given that each of the members of the Board, other than Mr. Klein, is independent we believe that the leadership structure currently utilized by the Board provides effective independent Board leadership and oversight.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Sessions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to the Companys Corporate Governance Principles, non-management directors of the Board are required to meet on a regularly scheduled basis without the presence of management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The non-executive Chairman of the Board leads these sessions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meeting Attendance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors met five times in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director attended at least 75% of the total meetings of the Board and committees of the Board of which the director was a member during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to the Companys Corporate Governance Principles, all directors are encouraged and expected to attend the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the directors attended the Companys 2016 Annual Meeting of Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk Management
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The responsibility for the day-to-day management of risks lies with the Companys management team; however, the Board has an active role, as a whole and also at the committee level, in overseeing the strategy and process for managing the Companys risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board regularly reviews information regarding the Companys business strategy, leadership development, resource allocation, succession planning, credit, liquidity and operations, as well as the risks associated with each.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys overall risk management program consists of periodic management discussions analyzing and mitigating risks, an annual review of risks associated with each of the Companys operating businesses and an annual review of risks related to the Companys compensation programs and practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annually, management identifies both external risks (i.e., economic) and internal risks (i.e., strategic, operational, financial and compliance), assesses the impact of these risks and determines how to mitigate such
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE (CONTINUED)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee manages the Companys risk management program and reviews the results of the annual assessment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management also provides the Audit Committee with quarterly updates on the Companys risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Audit Committee oversees management of the Companys financial risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys Compensation Committee is responsible for overseeing the management of risks relating to the compensation paid to the Companys executives and the Companys executive compensation plans and programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annually, the Compensation Committees independent compensation consultant conducts an assessment of the risks associated with the Companys executive compensation practices and programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation consultant conducts a more extensive review of all of the Companys broad-based compensation incentive arrangements every three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more information about that assessment see Compensation Risks below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee manages risks associated with the independence of the Board, potential conflicts of interest of Board members, and the Companys corporate governance structure, as well as management of risks associated with the environment, health and safety, diversity, philanthropy, global citizenship and sustainability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While each committee is responsible for evaluating certain risks and overseeing the management of such risks, the entire Board is regularly informed through committee reports about all of the risks described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Boards assignment of responsibility for the oversight of specific risks to its committees enables the entire Board, under the leadership of the non-executive Chairman and the Chief Executive Officer, to better monitor the risks of the Company and more effectively develop strategic direction, taking into account the various risks facing the Company, including the magnitude of such risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Risks
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committees compensation consultant conducts an annual assessment of the risks associated with the compensation policies and practices used to compensate the Companys executives and reports on the assessment to the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Compensation Committee, with assistance from its independent compensation consultant, reviewed the elements of executive compensation to determine whether any portion of executive compensation encouraged excessive risk taking and concluded that they do not.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, the executive compensation arrangements are consistent with the structure and design of other companies of similar size and industry sector, and the following risk-mitigating design features have been incorporated into the Companys programs:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company utilizes multiple long-term incentive vehicles with overlapping three year performance cycles;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company uses multiple and diverse performance metrics in incentive plans;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The upside on payout potential is capped for both short-term and long-term incentives;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The majority of an individuals total compensation mix is not derived from a single component of compensation; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company maintains stock ownership guidelines, a policy prohibiting hedging and pledging and a formal clawback policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described in our Compensation Discussion and Analysis, compensation decisions are made using a combination of objective and subjective considerations designed to mitigate excessive risk taking by executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE (CONTINUED)

sentences.text: Made recommendations as to best practices for structuring executive pay arrangements and executive compensatio (including the amount and form of compensation) consistent with the Companys business needs, pay philosophy, market trends and latest legal and regulatory considerations;

sentences.text: Performed an assessment of risks associated with the Companys executive compensation structure and design; an
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Nominating Committee reviewed an analysis of outside director compensation prepared by Meridian.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After reviewing the analysis, the Nominating Committee recommended and the Board approved an increase in the non-employee director annual cash fees from $80,000 to $90,000 and an increase in the value of the annual stock grant from $115,000 to $135,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Nominating Committee amended the Director Stock Ownership Guidelines to increase the multiple of the ownership requirement from 3 to 5 times the annual cash fee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash Fees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beginning in July 2016, the annual cash fee for services as a non-employee director of the Company was increased from $80,000 to $90,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The members of the Audit Committee (Messrs. Mackay, Morikis, Thomas, Waters and Wesley) and the Compensation Committee (Mses. Hackett and Kilsby and Messrs. Mackay, Morikis and Wesley) receive an additional annual cash fee of $7,500 for their service on these committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the chairperson of each of the Audit, Compensation and Nominating Committees receives an additional annual cash fee of $15,000 for such service (Mr. Waters, Ms. Hackett and Mr. Thomas, respectively).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Thomas receives an additional annual cash fee of $200,000 for his service as non-executive Chairman of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors may elect to receive payment of their cash fees in Company common stock rather than cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In April 2016, each non-employee director received an annual stock grant that was based on a set dollar value of $135,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of shares granted was determined by dividing the dollar value of the annual stock grant ($135,000) by the closing price of the Companys common stock on the grant date ($57.37), rounded to the nearest share.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, 2,353 shares of Company common stock were granted to each of the then-serving non-employee directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors may elect to defer receipt of their annual stock awards until the January following the year in which the individual ceases serving as a director of the Company.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To further align the Boards interests with those of stockholders, the Board established Stock Ownership Guidelines for non-employee directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the guidelines were amended to encourage non-employee directors to own Company common stock with a fair market value equal to five times their annual cash fee ($450,000 based on the annual fee of currently set at $90,000).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The guidelines allow directors five years from the date of the directors election to the Board to meet the guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors with less than one year of service at the time of the increase of the multiple were given five years from the date of the amendment to meet the increased guidelines.

sentences.text: All of our directors, other than Ms. Kilsby, currently meet the Stock Ownership Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Kilsby has five years from the date of the amendment to meet the guidelines.

sentences.text: 2016 Compensation Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use our compensation program to attract, motivate and retain the executives who lead our Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has established programs and practices that are designed to pay for performance and to align managements interests with those of the Companys stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that our compensation program helps drive Company performance by providing a significant amount of compensation in the form of equity, by utilizing both short-term and long-term incentives that are tied to Company performance, and by making efforts to balance fixed (base salary) and variable (annual cash and equity incentives) compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 executive compensation program was guided by the following principles:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity-based compensation aligns executives interests with stockholders, drives performance and facilitates retention of superior talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that equity-based compensation aligns the executives interests with those of our stockholders In 2016, the annual equity grant made up 66% of Mr. Kleins annual total target compensation and 54% (on average) of the other NEOs annual total target compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee approved the following equity-based compensation, as part of the 2016 annual equity grants:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual equity awards consisted of performance share awards (PSAs), restricted stock units (RSUs) and stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PSAs will be settled in Company stock only if the performance goals set for the cumulative three- year performance period are met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the goals were based on EPS (weighted 75%) and ROIC (weighted 25%) for the period January 1, 2016 through December 31, 2018;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The RSUs granted in 2016 are time-vested awards that will be settled in Company stock, in three equal annual installments, assuming the NEO remains employed through each vesting date; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options allow the NEOs to purchase Company stock at the market price set on the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The stock options granted in 2016 will vest in three equal annual installments, assuming the NEO remains employed through each vesting date, and expire ten years from the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Incentive compensation drives increasing profits and returns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee continues to believe that linking compensation to certain performance metrics results in increased profits and stronger returns, which supports improving stockholder returns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The vast majority of compensation awarded to NEOs is dependent upon Company performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Compensation Committee modified the goals used for determining annual incentive awards and set challenging performance goals in connection with the annual incentive awards and PSAs:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee modified the annual incentive award goals by adding a third goal that focused on the Companys strategic initiatives to increase operating efficiency, margins and sales (see pages 28-29 for further information about these changes).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 annual incentive awards were based on the following metrics:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EPS, ROIC and Working Capital Efficiency (WCE) were metrics used for Messrs. Klein, Wyatt, Biggart and, for a portion of the year, Fink;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MasterBrand Cabinets Operating Income (OI), Operating Margin (OM) and WCE were metrics used for Mr. Randich; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Moens OI, Sales Above Market and WCE were metrics used for the portion of the year for Mr. Fink when he began serving as President of that business unit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The metrics for three year PSAs were EPS and ROIC for all NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base salary represents the smallest portion of total target compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee continuously makes efforts to appropriately balance fixed (base salary) and variable (annual cash and equity incentives) compensation for each NEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, fixed compensation represented 15% and variable compensation represented 85% of Mr. Kleins annual total target compensation; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, fixed compensation represented 27% (on average) and variable compensation represented 73% (on average) of the remaining NEOs annual total target compensation.

sentences.text: RESULTS OF THE 2016 SAY-ON-PAY VOTE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we sought an advisory vote from our stockholders on NEO compensation (commonly referred to as Say-on-Pay).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: More than 97% of the votes cast for the Say-on-Pay vote were in support of the Companys executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even with this strong endorsement of the Companys pay practices, the Compensation Committee believes that it is essential to regularly review the executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Compensation Committee concluded that the compensation program provides rewards that it believes motivate our NEOs to maximize long-term stockholder value and encourage long-term retention.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the Compensation Committee did not make any changes to the design of the Companys executive compensation program in response to the 2016 Say-on-Pay vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Compensation Committee regularly evaluates the Companys executive compensation programs and makes adjustments as it deems appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Compensation Committee changed the performance metrics used to determine 2016 annual cash incentive awards (see pages 28-29 for information about this change) and approved changes to the Companys peer group to be used when evaluating 2017 executive compensation decisions (see pages 23-24 for information about this change).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, at the end of 2016, the pension program, which Mr. Klein participated in, was frozen.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In early 2017, the Compensation Committee also evaluated the metrics used in the Companys short-term and long-term incentive programs and changed the metrics for 2017-2019 PSAs which eliminated any duplication between the short-term and long-term performance metrics (see page 30 for information about this change).

sentences.text: PHILOSOPHY AND PROCESS FOR AWARDING NEO COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Philosophy of the Executive Compensation Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We strongly believe that executive compensation should be closely tied to Company performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation programs are designed to reward NEOs for the achievement of both short-term and long- term strategic and operationa goals that lead to the creation of long-term stockholder value, while at the same time avoid incentives that encourage unnecessary or excessive risk taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To accomplish this, the Compensation Committee has designed an executive compensation program that it believes:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Creates and reinforces a pay-for-performance culture;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Aligns managements interests with those of the Companys stockholders;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attracts, retains and motivates superior talent through competitive compensation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provides incentive compensation that promotes performance without encouraging excessive risk taking; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recognizes the cyclical nature of our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Maintaining a Competitive Compensation Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Peer Groups and Market Data
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When setting annual NEO compensation, the Compensation Committee uses compensation data from a group of similarly sized peer companies to evaluate compensation arrangements against those of the Company (the Peer Group).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annually, the Compensation Committee reviews and assesses the appropriateness of the Peer Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee did not make any modifications to the composition of the Peer Group used for evaluating 2016 executive compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Peer Group consisted of 19 consumer or housing product companies with a median 2015 revenue of $4.16 billion and median 2015 market capitalization for publicly-traded peers of $6.21 billion which aligns with the Companys 2015 revenue of $4.58 billion and 2015 market capitalization of $8.89 billion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Peer Group consisted of the following companies:

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that compensation decisions are complex and require a deliberate review of Company performance, peer compensation levels, experience of individual executives, and individual performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining executive compensation, the Committee considers all forms of compensation and benefits, and uses appropriate tools  such as tally sheets and market data  to review the value delivered by each component of compensation to each executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the Compensation Committee may determine that with respect to any individual it is appropriate for total target compensation or any particular element of compensation to meet, exceed or fall below the 50th percentile of the market data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The factors that might influence the amount of compensation awarded include market competition for a particular position, retention considerations, an individuals performance, possession of a unique skill or knowledge set, proven leadership capabilities or other business experience, tenure with the Company and internal pay equity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fortune Brands was added to the S&P 500 Index in June 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Due to this change and the Companys continued revenue growth and increased market capitalization, the Compensation Committee engaged Meridian to re-evaluate the Companys Peer Group to be used when evaluating 2017 executive compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eight new S&P 500 companies were added to the group based on their classification as cyclical companies with revenue (median 2015 revenue $6.18 billion) and market capitalization (median 2015 market capitalization $10.1 billion) more aligned to the Company.

sentences.text: Evaluating NEO Performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the end of each year, the Compensation Committee, in conjunction with the non-management members of the Board, conducts a formal evaluation of the Companys Chief Executive Officer (the CEO) to analyze his performance against strategic, financial and operational goals established at the beginning of the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee then sets the CEOs total target compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CEO reviews and evaluates each of the other NEOs relative to their performance against strategic, financial and operational goals established at the beginning of the year and then presents his evaluations to the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee evaluates the CEOs recommendations and then independently sets each of the other NEOs total target compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Maintaining Best Practices Regarding Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee maintains policies and procedures for itself and for certain of the Companys executives, ncluding the NEOs, many of which it believes represent best practices in corporate governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What We Do          Pay-for-PerformanceA significant portion of NEO annual total target compensation is tied to Company performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, 85% of Mr. Kleins and 73% (on average) of all other NEOs annual total target compensation was pay-at-risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ClawbackPolicy The Company may recover all or part of annual cash incentives and equity incentive compensation under certain circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: AnnualAssessment and Mitigation of Risks The Compensation Committee annually assesses whether our compensation programs, plans and awards are designed and working in a way that discourages excessive risk taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Double-Triggerin Change in Control Severance benefits are payable upon a change in control only if there is also a qualifying termination of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our equity award agreements also include double-trigger provisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MaximumPayouts on Incentives Annual cash incentive awards and PSAs are capped at 200%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TallySheets Tally sheets and wealth accumulation analyses are reviewed annually before making compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: StockOwnership Guidelines We maintain rigorous stock ownership guidelines for NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Multiple of base salary required: CEO = 6 CFO = 4 Other NEOs = 3   Executives are required to hold 50% of net shares from the vesting of PSAs and RSUs until the ownership requirement is met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IndependentCompensation Consultant Meridian advises the Compensation Committee on executive compensation matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meridian is prohibited from performing services for management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What We Dont Do           No Employment Contracts NEOs and other executive officers are employees at will.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company does not have employment contracts with any of its NEOs or other executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Hedging or Pledging Directors, NEOs and other officers are prohibited from hedging, pledging or otherwise encumbering shares of the Companys common stock, including holding shares in a margin account.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Tax Gross Ups NEOs and other executive officers are not entitled to tax gross ups in the event of a change in control and related termination or for perquisites (other than relocation expenses).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Backdating or Repricing of Stock Options Stock options are never backdated or issued with below-market prices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Repricing of underwater stock options without stockholder approval is prohibited (except in the event of certain extraordinary corporate events).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Excessive Perquisites Perquisites are limited to the executive health program, which includes an annual physical, and other benefits generally available to employees, such as company product purchase programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CEO and CFO have limited personal use of Company aircraft, however, each must reimburse the Company for such use.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base Salary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In setting 2016 base salary levels, the Compensation Committee (together with Mr. Klein for the NEOs other than himself) onsidered market data, the individual performance and the competitiveness of total direct compensation of each NEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, each of the NEOs received an annual base salary increase ranging from 3.2-5.4%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NEO Base Salary   Named Executive Officer   2016     2015     % Increase  Christopher J. Klein    $1,100,000      $1,060,000       3.8%   E. Lee Wyatt, Jr.

sentences.text: Annual Cash Incentive
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that annual cash incentive awards reinforce a pay-for-performance culture because the payment is based on the Companys financial results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annually, the Compensation Committee sets the percentage of base salary used to determine each NEOs cash incentive, as well as target, minimum and maximum performance goals for the Company and each operating company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The annual incentive payouts are based on the achievement of performance goals set at the beginning of the year and can range from 0% to 200%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Compensation Committee considered market data and the individual performance of each of the NEOs and decided to increase the percentage of base salary used to determine Mr. Kleins annual cash incentive award from 125% to 130%, Mr. Randichs annual cash incentive award from 65% to 70% and Mr. Biggarts annual cash incentive award from 60% to 65%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These increases were made to better align the annual cash incentive awards to the market data for similar positions and were made in recognition of the NEOs performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee did not make any other increases in the percentages used to determine the annual cash incentive awards for the other NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that the percentage of base salary levels were competitive compared to the market data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The percentage of base salary for each NEO for 2016 was:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Named Executive Officer    Percentage of Base Salary Christopher J. Klein    130% E. Lee Wyatt, Jr.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 85% David M. Randich    70% Nicholas I. Fink    65% Robert K. Biggart    65%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Compensation Committee decided to alter the performance goals used to determine annual cash incentive awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee decided to increase the number of performance metrics from two to three and refined the goals to increase focus on the Companys strategic initiatives to increase operating efficiency, margins and sales.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, the 2016 performance goals used to determine annual incentive awards were set as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For Messrs. Klein, Wyatt, Biggart and for a portion of the year, Mr. Fink, Fortune Brands EPS (weighted 60%), ROIC (weighted 20%) and company-wide WCE (weighted 20%), as compared to the 2015 performance goals of EPS (weighted 75%) and ROIC (weighted 25%).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For Mr. Randich, MasterBrand Cabinets OI (weighted 60%), OM (weighted 20%) and WCE (weighted 20%), as compared to the 2015 performance goals of OI (weighted 75%) and WCE (weighted 25%).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For Mr. Fink, Moens OI (weighted 60%), Sales Above Market (weighted 20%) and WCE (weighted 20%) for the portion of the year that he served as President of Global Plumbing Group, as compared to Moens 2015 performance metrics of OI (weighted 75%) and RONTA (weighted 25%).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believed that including a WCE goal reflects the importance of increasing efficiency and inventory control throughout the Company, using an OM goal for MasterBrand Cabinets focuses executives on increasing our businesses operating efficiency and pricing strategies and using a Sales Above Market goal (Sales) for Moen reflects the importance of increasing sales of our most profitable business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that these metrics focus executives on maximizing long-term stockholder value (EPS), operational efficiency (ROIC, OM and WCE) and profitability (OI, OM and Sales).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee set minimum, target and maximum annual performance goals used to determine each NEOs annual cash incentive award.
