sentences.text: Long-Term Incentive Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that equity awards both align managements interests with those of stockholders and reinforce a pay-for-performance culture.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 target equity-based compensation represented 66% of Mr. Kleins and 54% (on average) of the other NEOs annual total target compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In setting 2016 target long-term incentive awards, the Compensation Committee (together with Mr. Klein for NEOs other than himself) considered market data, the individual performance and the competitiveness of total direct compensation of each of the NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, Messrs. Kleins and Randichs target value were increased to reward their individual performance and better align their long-term incentive compensation to the market data for similar positions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The target long-term incentive award value of each NEOs 2016 equity-based awards was as follows and was comprised equally of PSAs (with the PSAs valued assuming achievement of the target performance level), RSUs and stock options:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Named Executive Officer   2016 Equity Award Value    2015 Equity Award Value    % Increase  Christopher J. Klein    $5,000,000     $4,615,000      8.3%  E. Lee Wyatt, Jr.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Share Awards: In 2016, one-third of the total target long-term incentive award value granted to the NEOs was made in the form of PSAs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The PSAs will be settled in shares of the Companys common stock only if the Company achieves specified EPS (weighted 75%) and ROIC (weighted 25%) goals during the cumulative performance period from January 1, 2016 through December 31, 2018, with vesting ranging from 0% to 200% of the target award based on performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No shares will be paid unless the minimum established performance goals are achieved and payout, if any, will not occur until early in 2019, following completion of the performance period and certification of the performance results by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The EPS and ROIC goals were intended to be challenging and require superior performance at the minimum, target and maximum payout levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that awarding PSAs with a cumulative three year performance goal drives long-term sustained growth and, as a result, management is rewarded if the long-term growth goals are met or exceeded.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In establishing performance goals for PSAs, the Compensation Committee considered the Companys strategic operating plan, the expected 3-year compound market growth rate, as well as key assumptions relating to share gains, pricing, material inflation and productivity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee based the performance goals on EPS and ROIC because it believes that these metrics are core drivers of the Companys performance and align the interests of management with the interest of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While EPS and ROIC are utilized in both short-term and long-term incentive awards, the short-term incentive awards include an additional operational metric (Working Capital Efficiency).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The short-term incentive awards were based 60% on EPS, 20% on ROIC and 20% on WCE over a one year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The long-term incentive awards were based on 75% on EPS and 25% ROIC over a cumulative three year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee based the performance goals on EPS and ROIC because it believed that the combined use of these metrics reflect sustainable growth and stronger returns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee annually evaluates and approves the metrics used in the Companys short-term and long-term incentive compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2017, the Compensation Committee evaluated the metrics used by the Company and its peers and decided to change the performance metrics used to determine the long-term incentive awards granted in 2017 to be based on EBITDA (earnings before interest, tax, depreciation and amortization) weighted 75% and RONTA (return on net tangible assets) weighted 25%, each over a cumulative three year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This change in long term goals eliminated any duplication that existed in prior awards between the short-term and long-term performance metrics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS (CONTINUED)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RSUs and Stock Options: One-third of the total target long-term incentive award value granted to the NEOs in 2016 was made in the form of RSUs and one-third was made in the form of stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that both RSUs and stock options further focus management on increasing stockholder returns and align the interests of management with stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RSUs awarded as part of the 2016 annual equity grant, vest in three equal annual installments, assuming the NEO remains employed through each annual vesting date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RSUs serve as a long-term retention device in a cyclical business, as an executive must remain employed with the Company through each of the three annual vesting dates to receive all of the shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee also believes that the value of RSUs is at risk to the NEOs because the value of RSUs will fluctuate based on the Companys stock price and only grows when the Companys long-term stock price increases.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options granted in 2016 vest in three equal annual installments, assuming the NEO remains employed through each annual vesting date, and expire ten years from the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that stock options are performance-based because the value of stock options grows when the Companys long-term stock price increases.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The value of stock options is at risk to the NEOs as they only realize a value if the Companys stock price increases after the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retention Equity Award
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In March 2016, the Compensation Committee granted 40,000 RSUs (with a grant date value of $2,047,000) to Mr. Wyatt as a retention device.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that this equity award will serve to retain Mr. Wyatt through each of the three vesting dates as he helps in the transition to a new chief financial officer upon his retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For this award, the Compensation Committee approved the following vesting schedule: 25% of the award vested in December 2016, 25% will vest in June 2017 and the remaining fifty 50% percent will vest in December 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee certified a payout level of 80.9%.

sentences.text: Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retirement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the NEOs are eligible for retirement benefits through the Fortune Brands Home & Security Retirement Savings Plan the Savings Plan), a tax-qualified defined contribution 401(k) plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that the Savings Plan benefits are consistent with competitive pay practices, and are an important element in attracting and retaining talent in a competitive market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Klein is the only NEO eligible for retirement benefits through the Moen Incorporated Pension Plan, a tax-qualified defined benefit pension plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefit accruals under the Moen Incorporated Pension Plan were frozen effective January 1, 2017, which means that participants, including Mr. Klein, no longer accrue additional benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Due to their respective hire and/or transfer dates, Messrs. Wyatt, Randich, Fink and Biggart are not eligible to participate in any of the Companys tax-qualified defined benefit plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to its tax-qualified plans, the Company provides non-qualified supplemental retirement benefits for accruals or contributions that would have been made under the tax-qualified plans but for limitations imposed by the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please see the narratives that follow the 2016 Pension Benefits table on pages 38-39 of this Proxy Statement for further information regarding these retirement plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company also provides a non-qualified deferred compensation plan, which allows executives to defer a portion of their cash compensation and RSU awards, however, none of the NEOs elected to make any deferrals in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Severance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has Agreements for the Payment of Benefits Following Termination of Employment (the Severance Agreements) with each NEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the terms of the Severance Agreements, each NEO is entitled to severance benefits upon a qualifying termination of employment (i.e., termination by the Company without cause or by the NEO for good reason).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that these Severance Agreements help accomplish the Companys compensation objectives of attracting and retaining superior talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee also believes that it is appropriate to provide executives with the protections afforded by these Severance Agreements and that these Severance Agreements promote management independence and help focus the attention of executive officers on the Companys business in the event of a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the Agreements contain double-trigger change in control provisions, which means that there must be both a change in control of the Company (or applicable operating company) and a qualifying termination of employment (i.e., termination by the Company without cause or by the NEO for good reason) before any enhanced benefits can be paid following a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NEOs are not entitled to any tax gross ups under the Agreements, including those related to the golden parachute excise tax under the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please see the Potential Payments Upon Termination or Change in Control table, as well as the narratives that follow for further information regarding the Severance Agreements and the treatment of outstanding equity upon a qualifying termination of employment or a change in control on pages 40 to 42.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Perquisites
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company provides a limited number of perquisites.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee authorized limited annual use of Company aircraft by Messrs. Klein and Wyatt.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, Mr. Klein and Mr. Wyatt reimbursed the Company for any personal use of Company aircraft, equivalent in amount to the cost of a first class ticket for each passenger on these flights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys executive health program makes annual medical examinations available to certain executives, including each of the NEOs, because the health of the NEOs is important to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company also provides broad-based plans which are generally available to employees such as reimbursement of certain relocation expenses incurred when the Company requires an employee to relocate, a match on charitable contributions and company product purchase programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Policies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clawback Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has a policy that allows it to recoup all or part of annual cash incentives or PSAs if there is a: (1) significant or material restatement of the Companys financial statements covering any of the three fiscal years preceding the gran or payment, or (2) restatement of the Companys financial statements for any such year which results from fraud or willful misconduc committed by an award holder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company also includes the right to recoup all or part of an executives other equity awards in the terms and conditions of the awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company maintains the following stock ownership guidelines for NEOs and other executives, which require them to hold a number of shares equal to a multiple of their annual base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ownership guidelines are as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Position    Stock Ownership Level as a Multiple of Base Salary   Chief Executive Officer      6   Chief Financial Officer      4   Operating Company Presidents      3   Senior Vice Presidents      3   Vice Presidents      1
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives have five years from the date of hire or date of promotion to acquire the requisite amount of stock and are required to hold 50% of net shares acquired from the vesting of PSAs or RSUs until the ownership guidelines are met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the NEOs currently satisfy the stock ownership guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Klein received pension benefit accruals through December 31, 2016 using the following formula: 1.75% of final average earnings multiplied by years of benefit service as of December 31, 2007, plus 1% of final average earnings multiplied by years of benefit service on and after January 1, 2008.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fortune Brands maintains a supplemental retirement plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The supplemental plan pays the difference between the benefits payable under the Moen Plan and the amount that would have been paid if the Code did not have a limitation on the amount of compensation permitted for inclusion of the calculation of benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The supplemental plan is an unfunded, non-qualified retirement plan, available to certain highly-compensated employees that participate in the Moen Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As Mr. Klein is the only NEO that accrued pension benefits under the Moen Plan through December 31, 2016, he is the only NEO that accrued pension benefits under the supplemental plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective January 1, 2017, the Company froze all future benefit accruals in the supplemental plan, including for Mr. Klein.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The present value of the accumulated benefits under the supplemental plan will continue to fluctuate after the freeze date based on changes in interest rates and actuarial assumptions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the supplemental plan, payment of benefits commences at termination of employment following attainment of age 55, subject to any delay required under Section 409A of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, early commencement of benefits would be calculated using a reduction of 6% per year prior to the attainment of age 62.

sentences.text: Termination of Employment and Change in Control Arrangements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To protect the Companys interests in retaining its top talent, the Company has Severance Agreements with each NEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the terms of the Severance Agreements, each NEO is entitled to severance benefits upon a qualifying termination of employment (i.e., termination by the Company without cause or by the NEO for good reason).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The severance benefits under the Severance Agreements consist of:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: an amount equal to a multiple (2 years for Mr. Klein and 1.5 years for all other NEOs) of the NEOs (1) base salary, (2) target annual cash incentive, plus (3) any profit sharing allocation and matching contributions under the applicable tax-qualified and non-qualified defined contributions plans for the year prior to the year in which the termination takes place;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: an additional number of months (equal to the severance multiple described above) of coverage under health, life and accident plans to the extent allowed under the applicable plan; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: an amount equal to the annual cash incentive award the NEO would have received based upon actual Company performance for the calendar year in which the termination date occurs, prorated for the NEOs service during the y
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Severance Agreements contain various restrictive covenants, including a one year non-solicitation provision, a non-disparagement provision, and a one year non-competition restriction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NEOs are also required to sign a release of legal claims against the Company to receive any severance payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the Severance Agreements contain provisions which provide for enhanced benefits in the event of a qualifying termination (i.e., termination by the Company without cause or by the NEO for good reason) following a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Severance Agreements contain double triggers, which means that there must be both a change in control of the Company (or applicable operating company) and a qualifying termination of employment before any enhanced benefits are paid.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event Mr. Klein is terminated within 2 years following a change in control, his multiple is increased from 2 years to 3 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event of termination within 2 years following a change in control of any of the other NEOs, the multiple is increased from 1.5 years to 2 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Severance Agreements do not allow for excise tax gross-ups on these amounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: AUDIT COMMITTEE MATTERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Report of the Audit Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is composed of five directors that are independent as defined under the New York Stock Exchange Listed Company Manual and Rule 10A-3 of the Exchange Act.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has a written charter that has been approved by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A copy of the Audit Committee Charter is available on the Companys website at http://ir.fbhs.com/committees.cfm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has appointed PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP (PwC) as the Companys independent registered public accounting firm for 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management has the responsibility for the Companys financial statements and overall financial reporting process, including the Companys systems of internal controls.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent registered public accounting firm has the responsibility to conduct an independent audit in accordance with generally accepted auditing standards and to issue an opinion on the accuracy of the Companys financial statements and the effectiveness of the Companys internal controls.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committees responsibility is to monitor and oversee these processes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this context, the Audit Committee has reviewed and discussed the audited financial statements and the Companys quarterly and annual reports to the SEC with management and the independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management has confirmed to the Audit Committee that the Companys financial statements were prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has met with the independent registered public accounting firm and discussed matters that are required to be discussed pursuant to applicable requirements of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board, including Auditing Standard No. 1301, Communications with Audit Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent registered public accounting firm has provided an unqualified opinion regarding the Companys financial statements for the year ended December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys independent registered public accounting firm has also provided the Audit Committee with the written disclosures and letter required by the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board regarding the independent registered public accounting firms communications with the Audit Committee concerning independence, and the Audit Committee has discussed with the independent registered public accounting firm that firms independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has also reviewed non-audit services provided by the independent registered public accounting firm and has considered the compatibility of these services with maintaining the auditors independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee annually reviews the independence and performance of the independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Factors such as independence, industry knowledge, communication and fees are considered.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A performance survey is completed by the Company at the end of each year to evaluate performance of the independent registered public accounting firm in multiple areas including quality of services, sufficiency of audit firm resources, communication and interaction as well as independence, objectivity and professional skepticism.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Results are shared with the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally the independent registered public accounting firm presents to the Audit Committee at the beginning of each year, a commitment letter outlining specific areas of focus for continued high quality client service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the end of each year, the independent registered public accounting firm presents to the Audit Committee and the Company a self-assessment against those commitments which is reviewed and discussed during the Audit Committee meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based upon the review and discussions with management and the independent registered public accounting firm, the Audit Committee recommended to the Board that the audited financial statements be included in the Companys Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2016 for filing with the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All PwC services were approved in advance by the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The aggregate fees billed by PwC during 2016 and 2015 are set forth in the table below:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) For both 2016 and 2015, Audit Fees represent the aggregate fees for audit services performed by PwC in connection with the audit of the Companys annual financial statements in its SEC Form 10-K filing and the review of the Companys quarterly financial information included in its Form 10-Q filings, as well as audit services performed over statutory reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2) For 2015, Audit-Related Fees represented fees billed by PwC in connection with the Companys offering of senior notes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (3) For both 2016 and 2015, Tax Fees represented services which included tax compliance, tax consulting, customs and transfer pricing services.

sentences.text: Approval of Audit and Non-Audit Services
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has adopted policies and procedures for the pre-approval of all audit and permissible non-audit services provided by our independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee annually reviews the audit and non-audit services to be performed by the independent registered public accounting firm during the upcoming year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee considers, among other things, whether the provision of specific non-audit services is permissible under existing law and whether it is consistent with maintaining the auditors independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee then approves the audit services and any permissible non-audit services it deems appropriate for the upcoming year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committees pre-approval of non-audit services is specific as to the services to be provided and includes pre-set spending limits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The provision of any additional non-audit services during the year, or the provision of services in excess of pre-set spending limits, must be pre-approved by either the Audit Committee or by the Chairman of the Audit Committee, who has been delegated authority to pre- approve such services on behalf of the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any pre-approvals granted by the Chairman of the Audit Committee must be reported to the full Audit Committee at its next regularly scheduled meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the fees described above under audit fees, tax fees and all other fees for 2016 were pre-approved by the Audit Committee pursuant to its pre-approval policies and procedures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 2  RATIFICATION OF APPOINTMENT OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC                             ACCOUNTING FIRM
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has appointed PwC as our independent registered public accounting firm for the year ending Decembe 31, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee and the Board recommend that you ratify this appointment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In line with this recommendation, the Board intends to introduce the following resolution at the Annual Meeting:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that the appointment of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as the independent registered public accounting firm for this Company for the year ending December 31, 2017 is ratified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A representative of PwC will attend the Annual Meeting to make a statement if he or she desires and respond to appropriate questions that may be asked by stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event the stockholders fail to ratify the appointment of PwC, the Audit Committee may appoint another independent registered public accounting firm or may decide to maintain its appointment of PwC.

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 3  ADVISORY VOTE ON NAMED EXECUTIVE OFFICER COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As required pursuant to Section 14A of the Exchange Act, the Company is providing stockholders with a vote to approve the compensation of the named executive officers as disclosed in this Proxy Statement, on an advisory, non-binding basis, which is commonly referred to as a Say-on-Pay vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has decided the advisory vote on executive compensation will be held on an annual basis at least until the next non-binding stockholder vote on the frequency that the advisory vote should be held.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that executive compensation should be closely tied to Company performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation programs are designed to reward executives for the achievement of both short-term and long-term strategic and operational goals, as well as the creation of stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To accomplish this, the Compensation Committee has designed an executive compensation program that:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Creates and reinforces a pay-for-performance culture;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provides incentive compensation that promotes performance without encouraging excessive risk
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company asks that you indicate your approval of the compensation paid to our named executive officers in 2016, as described in this Proxy Statement under the headings Compensation Discussion and Analysis and Executive Compensation, which includes the compensation tables and narratives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because your vote is advisory, it will not be binding on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Board and the Compensation Committee will review the results of the vote and consider the results when making future decisions regarding executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the reasons discussed above, the Board intends to introduce the following resolution at the Annual Meeting:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that the compensation of the named executive officers of the Company, as disclosed in this Proxy Statement under the headings Compensation Discussion and Analysis and Executive Compensation, including the compensation tables and their accompanying narrative discussion, is approved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: he Board of Directors recommends that you vote FOR Proposal 3.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Definitions of Terms: Non-GAAP Measures
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) Restructuring charges are costs incurred to implement significant cost reduction initiatives and include workforce reduction costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other charges represent charges or gains directly related to restructuring initiatives that cannot be reported as restructuring under GAAP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such charges or gains may include losses on disposal of inventories, trade receivables allowances from exiting product lines, accelerated depreciation resulting from the closure of facilities, and gains and losses on the sale of previously closed facilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, other charges includes estimated acquisition related inventory step-up expense in our Plumbing segment for the twelve months ended December 31, 2016 and our Cabinets segment for the twelve months ended December 31, 2015, in the cost of products sold category.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) The Company estimates that it would have incurred approximately $14 million of incremental corporate expenses if it had functioned as an independent standalone public company for the twelve months ended December 31, 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) Business separation costs are costs related to non-cash non-recurring costs associated with the modification of share-based compensation awards as a result of the Separation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) Represents actuarial gains or losses associated with our defined benefit plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Actuarial gains or losses in a period represent the difference between actual and actuarially assumed experience, principally related to liability discount rates and plan asset returns, as well as other actuarial assumptions including compensation rates, turnover rates, and health care cost trend rates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company recognizes actuarial gains or losses immediately in operating income to the extent they cumulatively exceed a corridor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The corridor is equal to the greater of 10% of the fair value of plan assets or 10% of a plans projected benefit obligation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Actuarial gains or losses are determined at required remeasurement dates which occur at least annually in the fourth quarter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Remeasurements due to plan amendments and settlements may also occur in interim periods during the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our operating income before charges/gains reflects our expected rate of return on pension plan assets which in a given period may materially differ from our actual return on plan assets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our liability discount rates and plan asset returns are based upon difficult to predict fluctuations in global bond and equity markets that are not directly related to the Companys business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that the exclusion of actuarial gains or losses from operating income before charges/gains provides investors with useful supplemental information regarding the underlying performance of the business from period to period that may be considered in conjunction with our operating income as measured on a GAAP basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We present this supplemental information because such actuarial gains or losses may create volatility in our operating income that does not necessarily have an immediate corresponding impact on operating cash flow or the actual compensation and benefits provided to our employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ELECTRONIC DELIVERY OF FUTURE STOCKHOLDER COMMUNICATIONS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you would like to reduce the costs incurred by our company in mailing proxy materials, you can consent to receiving all future proxy statements, proxy cards and annual reports electronically via e-mail or the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To sign up for electronic delivery, please follow the instructions above to vote using the Internet and, when prompted, indicate that you agree to receive or access stockholder communications electronically in future years.

sentences.text: The stockholder(s) whose signature(s) appear(s) on the reverse side of this proxy card appoint(s) each of CHRISTOPHER J. KLEIN, ROBERT K. BIGGART and E. LEE WYATT, JR. (and any other person chosen by Messrs. Klein, Biggart or Wyatt) proxies, to vote all shares of Fortune Brands Home & Security common stock which the stockholder(s) would be entitled to vote on at the Annual Meeting of Stockholders to be held on May 2, 2017 at the Renaissance Chicago North Shore, 933 Skokie Boulevard, Northbrook, Illinois at 8:00 a.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CDT, on Proposals 1, 2 and 3 referred to on the reverse side and described in the Proxy Statement, and on any other matters which may properly come before the meeting, with all powers the stockholder(s) would possess if personally present and at any adjournment or postponement of the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A majority of the proxies (or, if only one, then that one) or their substitutes acting at the meeting may exercise all powers conferred.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This proxy when properly executed will be voted in the manner directed by the stockholder(s).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless the stockholder(s) indicate(s) otherwise, the proxies will vote FOR the election of the nominees to the Board of Directors (Proposal 1) and FOR Proposals 2 and 3.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
